title: What are some upbeat songs with seriously sad or depressing lyrics? - Quora

response.answer_text: Drown With Me by Porcupine Tree   In short, the song is just beautiful.  To describe it further, it isn't as depressing or sad as it is dark and disturbing with sinister undertones; the creepiness of it is only magnified by the song's cheery and upbeat music. Like many other songs by Porcupine Tree, this one too remains a bit ambiguous about the whole premise and the meaning could be open for interpretation (Steven Wilson usually remains tight-lipped about the meaning of his songs). But in my opinion, on a literal interpretation, the lines are probably from the point of view of a psychotic killer/stalker who wants a girl (with issues) to be dead, drowned under the water, almost as if he'd be happy to liberate her from her woes. When you consider the verses below,   You're drowning in family thereWhen will you come up for air Don't feel you let 'em down'cause they have already drowned it could be assumed that the person is a serial killer who has already "helped" some girls before. Or it could be thought that the person has drowned some people who were the cause of the girl's depression and is telling her not to worry about them any more. In either case, it seems like the person is comforting the girl by pointing out that she won't be going alone. Alternatively, the song could be thought of in a positive light from the POV of the girl's lover, coaxing her to forget about her rues. But somehow, I'm not inclined to think of it that way. It doesn't really fit in with the theme of the album. Judge for yourselves.
